intro: Agalinis aspera, commonly known as rough agalinis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in open, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Agalinis aspera is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
